bow: how do other moms curb the neverending mom guilt know it all societal and or self imposed but really struggling with it as first time mom and first time at home parent guilt not working guilt if do guilt if turn on the tv guilt if do feed my son enough vegetables guilt do love staying home with him it seems never ending any other moms feel bogged down by guilt and if not how did you work past it edit lot of you have mentioned that society and the moms who seem to have it all together have put this pressure on me but honestly really think it is self imposed do compare myself to other moms really just really want to do great job think most of my guilt comes from not really liking being stay at home mom feel guilty that do like it because so many moms wish they could be home raising their kids or think they do at least but ca because of financial reasons anyway thank you all so much for the advice and reassurance think need to talk to adults more often guess do really have mom guilt do love staying home work part time and have the tv on all day sometimes get drive thru for dinner just to make it through the evening and get to bed time all of the guilt comes from the opinions of others you just have to trust yourself and forget about what other moms do and say struggled big time with this at first right now feeling much better but sure at points it will come creeping back in what been huge for me is talking with other moms and seeing that they re feeling the same things even those that are in opposite situations than mine stay at home moms are feeling guilty for not working working moms are feeling guilty for not staying home so really no matter what you do you can beat yourself about it all day long but working on concentrating on all the good things doing and that really so much of life is out of our hands so need to find the balance between doing what can and letting the rest go also try to have sense of humor about it all and strike good balance yes you do want to plop your kid in front of the tv all day but if they watch bit at grandma house they truly will not spontaneously combust also true that if my kid spends bit more time one day than normal in the bouncy chair or if he at daycare 20 extra minutes it all going to fine seriously well it sounds like you ve been dealing with it longer than me months last friday but definitely have it too pretty analytical sort so when start with the guilt try to ask myself some questions why exactly do feel guilty about what am afraid will happen are any of the other options have better just pinning down the amorphous fear that leads to guilt often helps because can see it usually silly no she not going to get adhd because let her watch tv to distract her from screaming if still feel bad can then know that there really nothing else to be done or sometimes realize could be doing something different and change it either way helps me let go of the guilt trip and sometimes just need to talk to my husband and he ll laugh at me and bring me back down to earth from whatever worry tizzy ve spiralled myself into where you raised in house hold of guilt religion sometimes can have that effect on people the christian religion is all about guilting people you have to find it in you to do what is best there nothing wrong with going to work there nothing wrong with staying at home there nothing wrong with turning the tv on there nothing wrong with formula feeding there nothing wrong with doing what you re doing as long as you care and your little one is happy you may read lot of judgemental stuff on here but an assure you that people who are less fortunate that your baby have turned out just fine if you re afraid of making mistakes that okay make them we all do even the self righteous holier than though bitches of the world make those mistakes they re the first ones to point out yours because think about how you feel they feel it too and dont want the finger pointed at them unsure exactly why you feel so guilty and who is shaming you but there is absolutely nothing to be ashamed of if you have question ask if you re unsure about what to do ask reddit has fantastic community of momma who love just chatting with each other life is really really short to be worried all the time just remember take every single piece of advice with grain of salt even my post love and light it sound kind of weird but the documentary *babies* really helped me there are cultural norms for raising kids in every part of the world and there are huge differences in how babies are cared for they all okay most grow and thrive and end up being productive members of society remembering that as long as doing my best and not abusing or neglecting my kids they will be fine and the less worrying about every detail the happier we all are stay at home mom and do feel guilty about being one feel guilty about not doing as much outside of the home as think should library trips play dates errands etc personally find myself at home lot with my year old bored yet not having the energy to go out and do all these exciting stimulating things with him think what makes me feel even worse about it sometimes is when turn on the tv and some sitcom comes on that shows mother always dressed in her best clothes running around all over the place with her children as happy and content as could be and look at myself and think should be that mom but not think once naps are thing of the past and he starts joining sports teams or another club of some sort this guilt feeling now will pass but sure ll start feeling guilty about something new perhaps not being part of the pta or something glad you posted this point of view happy to hear you re letting life happen and enjoying it bit more lt yeah feel that lot especially feel bad if have to go out ve had so many appointments the past couple weeks straight after nearly weeks apart ve also tried to get out at least once week with friend even if go out after he down for the night feel little guilty we just have to do the very best we can do and think we ll be alright why are you feeling guilt is it because of societal expectations of how you should feel about what you re doing imo if you want to work work do feel bad about not loving having to stay home with your son was exactly raised for total domesticity my parent banned me from the kitchen after burning water in the microwave and instead groomed me for college and career staying home with the kids drives me nuts love them to bits but give me more purpose than the same old cook clean wipe arse stop that ing fighting routine it normal and it completely ok so is being the kind of mom that adores every waking minute of their baby kids teenager it personal preference and we should never feel bad about it **if you re happy you re better mom ** the tv and veggies are really small beans man as long as you re not staring at it all day and ignoring your kid and you re feeding him *some* veggies no worries **tl dr ** if you re happy you re better mom do worry about what society expects or what you think people think of you doing the best can so have nothing to feel guilty about ai nobody got time for that ignore people expectations and judgments the same way ignore what people think of how much leg hair have or do have which sizes wear which books news agencies web sites tv shows enjoy what my spiritual religious views are who vote for and what my goals and dreams are you make your choices in life big and small based on million bits of knowledge and complex options that only *you* truly know no one else has the knowledge or right to judge you if you feel guilty about choice you re making examine it carefully and ask yourself if you really could do better include the context of that million bits of information that only you know are you turning on the tv because you know your son is likely to hurt himself if he not distracted while you make coffee and you re making coffee so that you can be happier kinder parent instead of short tempered one because you did get much sleep last night you re opting to have good relationship with your son and trying not to damage his self esteem instead of limiting tv as much as you think would be ideal if you really think you could do better then do it differently next time if you ca do any better then reassure yourself that you re doing the best you can and for heaven sake be realistic you re only human and *every* choice is trade off even if you were perfect you would be capable of making *all* the right choices because life does work that way by the way this is an easily proven fact if you take some courses in decision and game theory it an interesting field well you have no problem pointing fingers and being judge mental towards those you claim that do those things sorry if the christianity you ve encountered has been that way but do judge one church or one family as the way all or even most of christianity is to add different perspective we definitely are perfect but we should strive to be the best person and mother we can be some guilt is there for reason if you feel guilty about letting your toddler watch tv while you make breakfast before nap after nap so you can do chore in peace before bed etc that way too much suggest listening and figuring out your feelings rather than writing them off and saying you re good enough mom by not abusing your child like some other posts said good luck think that today society seeping into your brain we see movies tv shows and amazing stories on the news all the time where mom do it all and are successful its not real even the amazing moms on the news with 10 special needs kids full time job and volunteer jobs have bad days and get outside help have been down that road too and back down it again several times just this morning so asked me to get job so will dress up more often as was dressed up for volunteering at the school it got me doubting for second and then came back at him with maybe you should take me out on dates more often instead boom all your kids need is your love attention and some independence try to keep my goals simple and praise myself for goals accomplished my overall goal in its simplicity is to be better mom than my own mom she was good mom and turned out well so far so good was going to post about this movie as well mothers all over the world and throughout history have done just fine with less watched the movie with my son when he was about months old and sick with cold and an ear infection he was miserable and was desperate to just have peace for few minutes he loved watching the babies and the animals and saw that kids are resilient and pretty darn good at letting you know when they need something my son is now 10 months old and if he is happily playing by himself for 15 min no longer see it as 15 min of time wasted that could have been doing flashcards or going to the library when he comes crawling up and all over me that is when take it as my cue that it time to play together he an impossibly happy baby and far better at dealing with the stress of running household no ones life is sitcom thats what makes them enjoyable to watch they are fantasy deleted work hard to do the best of my abilities every day with my little ones granted not perfect and there is and will be always something to do or something can do better but reassured by the fact my kids are happy healthy growing and learning my husband is always the one to say do worry about it and verbalize that we do good if something is out of order we just know we ca be perfect but instead strive for better interesting point of view was not judging do care one way or another it is fact that the catholic church using shame in their religion to keep its people in check especially when it comes to sex but not limited too did not mean to imply that you yourself are into shaming others you may or may not be dont know and like to believe people are good until proven otherwise but your actions were in question here just op and her feelings of guilt sometimes not always but sometimes people who come from strong religious background one that uses guilt and shaming tend to have insecurities in lot of areas of their life sorry for the misunderstanding should have been more clear thanks for pointing it out deleted sorry to hear you feel that way deleted someone asked me the other day how do you do it all with kids and full time job said neglect neglect my job my house my husband my kids and definitely myself no one can give 100 of themselves to anything and as mom when you give less than 100 to your kids you feel guilty look around and see wow that persons home is so clean wow that person does crafts with their kid wow that person makes dinner every night wow that ones husband gets sex more than once month wow that person never yells wow their kid gets straight and it goes on and on and on so to not feel like shitty parent wife person focus on what do have job mostly like husband that is kinda hot and likes to have sexy times with me kids that are kind and hilarious perfect combination house where if you step on something you probably wo need tetanus shot because that is all can do with my 100 and that is enough feel like too sometimes sometimes worry that failing my son but think it is perfectionism at least in my case women and men but moreso women in this society think are pressured to be so damn perfect perfect mom perfect wife perfect job perfect house perfect life we strangle ourselves with perfection all the time and in infinite ways when get stressed out about something get even more perfectionistic and while love my son more than thought was possible he is stress good stress but stress babies are hard work and we want so badly to do it right we are afraid of the consequences if we do and all that try to focus on doing the best can not perfection because it is never going to be perfect if shooting for perfection never going to have time for sleeping or eating and then what kind of mother would be when sleep deprived starving mess it helps me to remember that my mom inbox is always going to have something in it there is always something more could do but sometimes really just need to relax or going to lose my mind hopefully this ramble makes some sort of sense was raised in secular humanist household and have ton of mommy guilt issues more so than my friend who grew up catholic think religion is pretty irrelevant if anything communing with the other women at my church parenting group and hearing they have similar problems to mine has been hugely helpful can only speak for myself but the way worked past it is that just let it go accepted the fact that am not perfect that my demons will present themselves from time to time that at some point in their lives my kids will think was crappy parent that there is nothing can do about it that other parents have just as hard of time as do and that people are going to judge no matter what did or did do finally had to realize that the guilt that was carrying was making things worse took the things that *could* control how handled misbehavior and accidents the state of my home dinner choices etc and spent some time constantly reminding myself how *wanted* to act and compared it to how *actually* acted eventually my first instinct went from yelling came from family of yellers to remaining calm and in control patiently added vegetables to my son list of do and do foods de cluttered so it would be easier to keep up with the house quit caring about what people thought and subsequently quit trying to keep up with the joneses then had fewer things to feel guilty about then was less worried then was more calm do you see the cycle the same can be applied to other areas be it the tv the state of your house the types of dinners your kids eat it can be changed but it wo happen overnight it will feel like it not happening at all but it is and it will be over before you know it and do feel bad about not embracing being sahm *hated* it it was until got very scary smack in the face that decided to remember *why* stayed at home in the first place and embrace the little chunder monkeys with their picky palettes and sticky fingers but it not for everyone and that is perfectly okay you are no less of mother finally keep reminding yourself it may not be fun *right now* but it wo last forever lady you know what up thank you your honesty is so refreshing every day am getting closer to my goal total acceptance and love of my version of mothering it imperfect and at times lots of times filled with chaos and drive thru and tv and ipad games but it also filled with love and gardening and tea parties and bedtime stories she sees me trying my best and working hard not going to win any crafting contests we ve never done professional portraits of her or the family and the list of things we have done goes on and on screw it agree with emmacat and you it depends on the individual the parish the priests and lay leadership and the community as whole some parish communities are loving and supportive and their parishioners are true believers and do feel shamed or guilted others like the one in which was raised were real fire and brimstone style parishes condemning everyone for everything am still recovering from the emotional abuse of my religious upbringing and the self esteem issues developed making generalizations even this one is inherently unfair because it cuts off the outliers in order to be able to make simpler statement everyone has different experiences and they are all valid great comeback hope you get some date nights your point about the super moms getting outside help is spot on it takes village is phrase because it did take village to raise children the focus on the nuclear family separating from the extended family is relatively new thing partly talking out my ass here because the articles read about this were 10+ years ago there is certainly no shame in asking for help your feelings are totally normal think it impossible to not feel mom guilt at one point or another the fact that we share so much of our lives via social media means we are constantly comparing ourselves to other moms it easy to forget that those other moms are probably presenting the best part of their lives leaving out the diapers and the failed recipes and the daily failures my advice cut back on the facebook twitter whatever spend more time living in the real world and less in the virtual world ve severely cut back on my facebook use in the past couple weeks and seriously happier person because of it keep up the good work momma it one of the hardest jobs out there this was lovely this is normal just had to look at what was providing for my child and say what did my parents do for me as child if feel they did enough for me then say was this comparable is my child healthy is my child happy am happy then keep calm and carry on it hard because we are constantly being told by tv magazines other people the radio etc that there are new better things to do to be the best possible parent well guess what we ca do everything my absolute favorite philosophy was wwcmd what would cave man do seriously humans have survived for 10s of thousands of years just fine without child psychology self help books and the internet not saying it was the best of times definitely like that in my early 30s not senior citizen as it would have been in the days of the cave person however it lets me take deep breath and say to myself that the caveman would have just made due with what was on hand if the tv is on hand for brain break for mama or even more important to occupy squeaky babe so mama can poop in peace the caveman would have loved it cavemen had family and friends around at all times to take the kid well we do have that so we make due the best we can too this also helps greatly in instances where you find yourself without all of your normal accoutrements to care for or entertain the baby good advice might be to join mommy group so you can share your feelings when you talk about it and realize that it not just you it helps you to say well these people are doing great job and have no reason to feel this guilt am doing great job too so also have no reason to feel this guilt and it gives you the power to ignore it good luck mama amen there was no working past it for me this is my child am raising him how see fit if you have better way may adopt your way of doing things if you just think you have better way then probably will nod and smile while you explain it to me and then forget it five minute later work do feel guilty formula feed do feel guilty let my kids watch some television in moderation and do feel guilty either for letting them watch or for not letting them watch my kids do watch wrestling it is not allowed while they are awake my older son gets teased at school because he does know who all the wrestlers are supposed to feel guilty do let them play outside and do feel guilty keep them inside some days for various reasons and do feel guilty some days they get five servings of fruit and veggies some days they do that used to bother me now they get multivitamin no guilt do love spending every waking moment with my kids no guilt human do let it suck you in it will destroy you and your ability to parent how old is your kid find that it gets easier as the baby gets older and after the second kid but yeah guilt the first couple of years can be overwhelming is your child happy and thriving if yes then you re doing it right just remember that my mantra when was first time mom was at least not crack whore you re doing it waaay better than lots of people relax and know it gets better ha find myself often saying similar things and ll admit that it helsp but then always like yeah but want high standards for myself as parent dammit think it is perfectionism for me as well do want to just half ass an important thing like parenting but in trying to be perfect driving myself crazy ca do the impossible see this is where usually land want high standards for myself as parent and if do live up to them beat myself up for it do know how to not strive to be that perfect parent it fucking impossible and driving myself insane trying to do it this is great advice thank you great advice saw this doc before was parent and will revisit thanks you pegged me recovering catholic here it makes perfect sense and is spot on gah the photos all of my friends did the engagement wedding maternity new baby etc got pregnant halfway through planning our wedding and surprise twins it been whirlwind years and professional photos never fit into that deleted have those moments too where know there is something more constructive could be doing for with my child but try to keep it in perspective when compare my parenting decisions to those of friends those with whom have an honest relationship about the ups and downs of raising children do think any of them are doing it any better than am nor are they doing it worse no one is perfect mom 100 of the time and if your mistakes are occasional chicken nuggets and tv let it go think of whenever an askreddit thread that talks about parents makes the front page and how many of those people have these horror stories about abuse and abandonment if you care enough to question if you re doing it right you re on the right path deleted first of all just being aware of it is huge step like to pretend that my first child is my third this delusion gives me more time to do other things feel guiltier about first child is exhausting and by the time mother gets to the third there no way she can stay as crazy alert as the first time around if his pants are on backwards and his shoes are on the wrong feet let it go there is nothing more futile than arguing with toddler the fewer rules have the fewer interventions have about washing his face the less likely he is to waste my energy with fit he does not get baths every night we do not have 30 minute bedtime routine accept will feel guilty about something no matter what can rationalize the cheaper excellent quality daycare but still feel like hell that he not going to the montessori with swimming and ballet class even though we ll save like 400 month which will make for sweet vacation at the end of the year can still send him to swimming and dance yet know will be judged by myself also try to look at it from the perspective of my 80 year old self will my 80 year old self wish that would have spent more time with my husband instead of cleaning the house every night will my son notice he did grow up with the complete disney dvd library if my 80 year old self will laugh in my face then lay it at her feet and move on this million times this used to feel so guilty every time let my daughter watch tv then realized that it was definitely better than me being cranky and irritable all day long because had had freaking shower and oh my goodness the vegetables all the moms saw had kids who would gnaw on cucumber and my eldest would touch anything green do the best you can do what makes you and your kids happy and screw everyone else not literally but you get the idea so many photos is my little point and shoot not good enough prefer my messy kid hand shoving spaghetti into her face pictures better than black and white with weird blankets and beads any day am but know for myself am not one of those mothers who is happy to be at home taking care of everrrything and encouraging the right actions and thinking of the children ca cope and feel guilty that the stress of finances is on my husband who contracts which adds more stress to the guilt never knowing when his last day or first day will be so ve gone back to work do feel guilty yes but are my kids happy yes so stuff it away until need good cry and make sure ask for help when it really bogs me down the problem have with my guilt or frustration is not taking it out on my husband it ssomething am working on though work full time now with children from ages 11 to deleted just the fact that you spend time worrying about means you probably have pretty high standards it was just way to remind myself that regardless of my flaws and failures my baby had it pretty good thanks to me sigh do ve reconciled myself to the fact that probably going to screw them up somehow anyway so do what can my nine year old said you know you re really very kind today so either doing an awesome job or pushover like this advice am the youngest of five children and know by the time my mom got to me she barely knew when she was coming and going on my hard days try to picture her with five kids running around and remind myself that we are all fine and well adjusted think we have lot in common do love staying at home and think about going back to work quite often but someone once told me in 20 years you wo regret that you stayed home with your kid but if you went back to work you might regret that in 20 years that resounds in my head so try to make the best of it and have fun with him very true thanks for reminding me late to the party but just try to go with the flow do what can and dont worry about what cant and try not to compare us with other families ya know unless we are better than them my kid is one and half yes can see it getting easier after the second when you have less time to dwell on it and you re just trying to keep your shit together maybe little chaos would benefit me imo kids need time to themselves just like adults do the documentary babies really helps me because my son fucking loves watching it one of his favorite scenes is when hattie is peeling the banana if you do compare yourself to other moms then does your guilt come from you thinking you are doing your best that where mine does weeks with our second and do want to do *anything* feel guilty for not getting my year old to child care at the ymca but just do want to go anywhere keep saying we re going tomorrow you do have to like being sahm one too and kind of wish worked part time did before my husband got non student job and it was about the right amount of time away from my child but if may ask how old is yours baby stage is pretty isolating imo because you do *have* to bring them out to get socialized they do play with others until at least usually closer to years old but you ve got to get out of the house otherwise it easy to get in rut my local ymca has child care area and they take babies as young as weeks lot of moms come in for the exercise classes and then you get to talking with other moms and make some friends and my husband also get some me time twice week go out to my knitting circle with lots of adults is it still on netflix maybe my monkey would watch it with me it still on canadian netflix lucky thanks for the reply **alcohol** but really you just learn to deal do think it ever truly goes away 24 and my mom still talks about feeling guilty for things she did when was an infant was trying to put in to words how manage to cope with being less then perfect and this is exactly it very well put thanks well put used to have mom guilt spent over year making myself miserable doing all the housework myself making wonderful meals doing all the correct parenting things putting my kid in everything possible doing all the pinterest mom things it sucks was in horrible mood all the time was stretched too thin and had even more overwhelming guilt over being bitch all the time so stopped no no longer make everything from scratch but do have vegetable at every meal no no longer every second of my free time after work with my kid but do make it point to spend time with her throughout the week and talk about her day at school my husband and daughter both have their own chores around the house let go little big and let her have more responsibilities no she does fold or put her laundry away perfectly but that one more thing off my plate to deal with eventually came to terms with how was going to be as parent and realized everyone is different and it sucks trying to be perfect now of the attitude this is what works best for my kid and my family and eff off if you want to lecture me on my parenting
